programme.title: UFC Countdown
programme.desc: Analysts preview UFC 316 and the main event as Merab Dvalishvili (19-4) defends his bantamweight title against Sean O'Malley (18-2); other bouts include: Julianna Pena (13-5) defending her bantamweight title against Kayla Harrison (18-1).

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 3 seed Arkansas ranks among the top 15 nationally in home runs and ERA this season; No. 14 seed Tennessee looks to become the first program since South Carolina in 2010-11 to win back-to-back College World Series titles.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Keyshawn Davis (13-0-0, 9 KOs) defends his WBO World lightweight title for the first time since beating Denys Berinchyk for it on Feb. 14; Edwin De Los Santos (16-2-0, 14 KOs) looks to rebound from a lightweight title loss to Shakur Stevenson.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Hunter Dobbins (2-1, 4.06) held the Angels to one run in five innings on June 2, seeking his first win since April 18; Carlos Rodon (8-3, 2.49) is 7-0 with a 1.27 ERA in his last nine starts, including a 4-0 record and a 0.72 ERA in his last four.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to the College World Series at Charles Schwab Field Omaha in Omaha, Neb. from June 13-23; No. 3 Arkansas, No. 4 Auburn, No. 5 North Carolina and No. 6 LSU are the top remaining seeds in field.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Indiana outscored Oklahoma City, 35-25, in the fourth quarter to come back and win Game 1, 111-110, to gain the early 1-0 lead behind a jumper from Tyrese Haliburton with 0.3 seconds left; Pascal Siakam led the Pacers with 19 points in the win.

programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt

programme.title: Get Up

programme.title: WNBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the WNBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In 1998, a year after the Chicago Bulls defeated Utah in the NBA Finals, their path to a sixth title only gets more challenging as it goes along, as a brutal seven-game series against the Indiana Pacers decides the Eastern Conference.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Oregon State won back-to-back titles in 2006-07 before adding a third crown in 2018; Florida State, which seeks its 25th College World Series appearance, as three runner-up finishes (1970, 1986, 1999), but has never won a title in Omaha, Neb.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 6 seed LSU leads all remaining programs in the field with seven College World Series titles and seeks its 20th all-time appearance in Omaha, Neb.; West Virginia has never advanced to the College World Series in program history.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In June of 1998, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls take on the Utah Jazz in an NBA Finals rematch that saw the Bulls win in six games in the 1997 Finals, looking for a sixth championship and a perfect ending for "The Last Dance."

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: With Michael Jordan's extraordinary fame came extraordinary scrutiny, and in 1993, it all felt like it came to a head with the Chicago Bulls' pursuit of a third straight title shadowed by question marks about Jordan's gambling.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan's fame peaked to unparalleled levels in the early 1990s in the wake of consecutive NBA titles and a starring role on the Olympic Dream Team, his image as "Air Jordan" made him a profoundly significant cultural figure.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: The world's top-ranked cornhole players finish out the the ACL Signature #2 and Open #13 at the Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, Arizona for a combined $50,000 in prize money; ACL Pro Teams contest a set of regular season matches.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: The world's top-ranked cornhole players finish out the the ACL Signature #2 and Open #13 at the Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, Arizona for a combined $50,000 in prize money; ACL Pro Teams contest a set of regular season matches.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan pushes his teammates hard for a sixth NBA title, his intensity and hunger for basketball dominance is in stark contrast to his mindset in October 1993, when he stunned the world by walking away from the game.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: The winner of each of the eight Super Regionals advances to the College World Series at Charles Schwab Field Omaha in Omaha, Neb. from June 13-23; No. 3 Arkansas, No. 4 Auburn, No. 5 North Carolina and No. 6 LSU are the top remaining seeds in field.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas, Joe Dumars, Rick Mahorn, Dennis Rodman and Bill Laimbeer led the Detroit Pistons to back-to-back NBA championships in 1989 and 1990, but the team's tactics earned them a tough reputation and a memorable nickname that has endured.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan would famously use even the smallest slight imaginable to motivate himself against an opponent, and when his NBA comeback in 1995 fell short in the playoffs, he worked harder than ever to return to form and prove his doubters wrong.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: UFC The Walk
programme.desc: Memorable bouts throughout UFC history are relived, showcasing the two fighters' paths to the bout, the training they went through to get ready for the contest and highlights from the bout to show who came out of the Octagon the winner.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Top fighters from around the world engage in a full-contact combat sport that allows a wide variety of fighting methods and skills from Mixed Martial Arts traditions as the fighters look to move up the rankings and stake claim to championship gold.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two of the more prestigious names in the UFC coach their teams of up-and-coming fighters, who are in search of a UFC contract for winning the season, as they compete against each other in the Octagon and in challenges outside of the bouts.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: With the help of Shaquille O'Neal and Penny Hardaway, the Orlando Magic franchise vaulted to the top of the NBA in the 90s and became a pop culture phenomenon, but as with all stories, the fairy tale came to an end when Shaq departed for the Lakers.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Garrett Crochet (5-4, 1.98) allowed two or fewer runs in his last seven starts after holding Atlanta to one run on June 1; Ryan Yarbrough (3-0, 2.83) is 3-0 with a 2.06 ERA in his five starts after holding the Dodgers to one run on June 1.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the eighth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Bryson DeChambeau won the individual title with a two-shot victory over teammate Charles Howell III, while Crushers GC secured the team crown in South Korea in May.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: England (2-0-0) has won each of the six all-time encounters against Andorra (0-0-2), including a 5-0 road victory on Oct. 9, 2021, as Ben Chilwell, Bukayo Saka, Tammy Abraham, James Ward-Prowse and Jack Grealish each found the back of the net.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the eighth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Bryson DeChambeau won the individual title with a two-shot victory over teammate Charles Howell III, while Crushers GC secured the team crown in South Korea in May.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Chip Ganassi Racing secures a win, with Marcus Ericsson taking the top spot at St. Petersburg; the infamous Andretti Autosport, with seven-time champion Colton Herta in the lead, aim to return to form; Arrow McLaren fight to overtake their rivals.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the main race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Multiple racing teams arrive at the Thermal desert for a shot at glory, but all eyes are on bitter rivals Team Penske and Chip Ganassi Racing, a longstanding feud that starts with a bang at the opening race in St. Petersburg.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the main race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-4) split two meetings with the Battlehawks this season after earning a 27-15 triumph on the road in Week 3; St. Louis (8-2), the defending champion and winner of its last six contests, led the UFL with just 16.3 points allowed per game in 2025.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Portugal claimed a 2-1 comeback victory against Germany in the semi-finals round on June 4 with goals from Francisco Conceição and Cristiano Ronaldo; Spain beat France, 5-4, on June 5, led by a pair of goals scored by Lamine Yamal.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Rajah Caruth secured his first win of the season with his victory at Nashville over points leader Corey Heim, his eighth podium finish of 2025; Truck Series races at Michigan for the first time since Zane Smith won in 2020 over Christian Eckes.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Matchweek Highlights
programme.desc: Experts and analysts break down all the action and developments from each UEFA Nation League and look ahead to upcoming matchups, including an in-depth look at stats, club interviews, plays of the game, injury updates and keys to victory.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Coverage of professional baseball.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the eighth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Bryson DeChambeau won the individual title with a two-shot victory over teammate Charles Howell III, while Crushers GC secured the team crown in South Korea in May.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Rajah Caruth secured his first win of the season with his victory at Nashville over points leader Corey Heim, his eighth podium finish of 2025; Truck Series races at Michigan for the first time since Zane Smith won in 2020 over Christian Eckes.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: South Sydney (6-0-6) suffered a 36-30 setback to New Zealand at Accor Stadium on May 31; Canberra (10-0-3) has won five of the past six meetings with the Rabbitohs, including a 32-12 victory last season, as Jordan Rapana scored two first-half tries.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Cavalry claimed a 2-1 victory against York United in their first meeting of the season on May 2 with goals scored by Tobias Warschewski and Fraser Aird; Julian Altobelli found the net with United's lone goal of the defeat at home.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the eighth event of the season for a $25 million purse; Bryson DeChambeau won the individual title with a two-shot victory over teammate Charles Howell III, while Crushers GC secured the team crown in South Korea in May.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Portugal claimed a 2-1 comeback victory against Germany in the semi-finals round on June 4 with goals from Francisco Conceição and Cristiano Ronaldo; Spain beat France, 5-4, on June 5, led by a pair of goals scored by Lamine Yamal.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by 71 points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 38 points and Greg Anderson leads Dallas Glenn in Pro Stock by 50 points following Epping, the seventh event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the main race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Collingwood (10-2-0) has won six of the seven previous meetings with the Demons, including a 103-57 victory last season in Round 24; Melbourne (5-7-0) had its two-match winning streak ended with a 91-63 loss to St. Kilda in Round 12.

programme.title: 2026 UEFA World Cup Qualifiers
programme.desc: Moldova (0-0-2) plays its first match on the road after falling to Norway (March 22) and Estonia (March 25); Italy (0-0-1), which allowed three first-half goals to suffer a 3-0 setback to Norway in Week 3, is 3-0-0 all-time against Selectionata.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: Mexico defeated Costa Rica, 4-0, to advance, and beat Canada in the group stage, 4-2, behind two goals from Montserrat Saldivar and one from Maria Gonzalez; Canada shut out United States, 1-0, behind the lone goal from Lea Larouche.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Marco Bezzecchi secured his first win since 2023 with a victory at Silverstone, while six-time champion Marc Marquez increased his lead over his brother, Alex, to 24 points; Marc Marquez won the sprint race at Aragon last year over Jorge Martin.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Rajah Caruth secured his first win of the season with his victory at Nashville over points leader Corey Heim, his eighth podium finish of 2025; Truck Series races at Michigan for the first time since Zane Smith won in 2020 over Christian Eckes.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: DC (6-4) split two meetings with the Battlehawks this season after earning a 27-15 triumph on the road in Week 3; St. Louis (8-2), the defending champion and winner of its last six contests, led the UFL with just 16.3 points allowed per game in 2025.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Championship
programme.desc: Mexico defeated Costa Rica, 4-0, to advance, and beat Canada in the group stage, 4-2, behind two goals from Montserrat Saldivar and one from Maria Gonzalez; Canada shut out United States, 1-0, behind the lone goal from Lea Larouche.

programme.desc: Portugal claimed a 2-1 comeback victory against Germany in the semi-finals round on June 4 with goals from Francisco Conceição and Cristiano Ronaldo; Spain beat France, 5-4, on June 5, led by a pair of goals scored by Lamine Yamal.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Austin Green secured his first Menards Series win of his career with his victory at Charlotte over Grant Enfinger; Connor Zilisch averaged 149.44 en route to his win at Michigan last year, beating eventual 2024 champion Andres Perez by 0.701 seconds.

programme.title: UEFA World Cup Qualifying Matchnight Highlights
Canadian Shield Soccer
programme.desc: Invitational tournament contested by hosts Canada plus Ukraine, Ivory Coast and New Zealand; draws will go to penalties to award two points with winners and losers earning standard points as teams strive to top the standings after two matches each.

programme.title: NHRA Pro Mod Series
programme.desc: The top pro modified drivers compete against each other with three different engine setups in nitrous, blower and turbo, featuring detailed coverage of all the racing action, updates on track conditions, and highlights of memorable moments.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: Guido Migliozzi of Italy captured his fourth career DP World Tour title after making birdie on both the 16th and 18th holes on the final round to finish at 11-under 273 before defeating Joe Dean and Marcus Kinhult in a playoff in last year's edition.

programme.title: Korn Ferry Tour Golf
programme.desc: Adrien Dumont de Chassart, the 2023 Korn Ferry Tour Rookie of the Year, carded a 6-under 65 over the final 18 holes to finish at 21-under 264 and captured his maiden professional title with a playoff victory over Josh Teater in last year's edition.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Ashleigh Buhai of South Africa carded a 6-under 65 for the second consecutive round on Day 3 in last year's edition to finish at 14-under 199 for a one-stroke triumph over South Korea's Hyo-Joo Kim; Buhai won the 2022 AIG Women's Open.

programme.title: Golf Central Pregame
programme.desc: Tournament updates and the latest headlines from the world of golf with insightful commentary from journalists and golf professionals; coverage includes highlights, expert analysis, exclusive interviews, special features and roundtable discussions.

programme.title: Golf Central
programme.desc: Experts explore the latest news and reports surrounding the world of golf, including daily coverage from the biggest tournaments, live updates, highlights of top moments, in-depth analysis about contenders and recent results, and interviews.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $9,800,000 purse, debuted in 1904 and was won by England's Jack Oke; Robert MacIntyre became the first Scotsman to win the event in 98 years with his one-shot victory over American Ben Griffin in last year's edition.

programme.title: Korn Ferry Tour Golf
programme.desc: The winner of the tournament earns $180,000 and receives 500 points towards the Korn Ferry Tour Points List; Belgium's Adrien Dumont de Chassart, who was making his Korn Ferry Tour, secured a playoff victory over Josh Teater in last year's edition.

programme.title: Korn Ferry Tour Golf
programme.desc: The winner of the tournament earns $180,000 and receives 500 points towards the Korn Ferry Tour Points List; Belgium's Adrien Dumont de Chassart, who was making his Korn Ferry Tour, secured a playoff victory over Josh Teater in last year's edition.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Robert MacIntyre of Scotland took home a payday of nearly $1.7 million after carding a 2-under 68 over the final round to finish at 16-under 264 to hold off American Ben Griffin for a one-stroke triumph in last year's edition of the tournament.
